str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a compound of a and the base of poreuomai; to have no way out, i.e. Be at a loss.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To flash (with, then like, lightning), be lustrous. Probably from aster; to flash as lightning.
Clothing, raiment, vestment, robe. From hennumi; dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
